patterns: what to eat in calorie deficit
responses: Low-calorie foods include cucumber, spinach, broccoli, boiled eggs, grilled chicken, lentils, apples, and yogurt.
To reduce belly fat, avoid sugar and refined carbs. Eat high-protein foods, fiber-rich vegetables, and healthy fats like nuts and olive oil.

Muscle gain diet example:

Breakfast: Eggs + whole wheat bread + milk
Lunch: Rice + chicken/beef + vegetables
Snack: Peanut butter sandwich
Dinner: Fish or lentils + salad

Eat in calorie surplus and consume 1.6â€“2.2g protein per kg body weight.
High-protein foods include eggs, chicken breast, fish, beef, lentils, chickpeas, Greek yogurt, milk, and tofu.

Vegetarian diet plan:
Breakfast: Oats + nuts
Lunch: Lentils (daal) + brown rice + salad
Snack: Fruits
Dinner: Paneer/tofu + vegetables

Ensure enough protein from lentils, beans, tofu, and dairy.

Lunch: 1 roti + sabzi + daal
Snack: Fruit
Dinner: Grilled chicken + salad

Avoid naan, paratha, sweets, and fried food.

Beginner workout plan: 3 days per week. Day 1: Full body strength. Day 2: Cardio. Day 3: Rest and stretching.
For weight loss, combine strength training with cardio like brisk walking, cycling, or HIIT 3â€“5 days per week.
For muscle gain, follow split training (chest, back, legs, shoulders) and focus on progressive overload.
HIIT stands for High-Intensity Interval Training. It alternates short bursts of intense exercise with brief recovery periods.
Progressive overload means gradually increasing weight, reps, or intensity to stimulate muscle growth.
A balanced diet includes protein, complex carbs, healthy fats, vegetables, fruits, and adequate water intake.
Weight loss diet: High protein, low sugar, portion control. Example: Eggs + oats for breakfast, grilled chicken + salad for lunch, light dinner with vegetables.
Muscle gain diet: Eat in calorie surplus. Include eggs, chicken, rice, lentils, milk, nuts, and healthy fats.
